isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - ENGINE SYMPTOMS DIAGNOSTICS - Test Procedures - Rough Idle

item.para: Engine oil (aerated, incorrect grade, low oil level, extended drain interval)
Electronic control system faults (ECM and IDM)
Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR) valve stuck open
Exhaust system to cab/chassis ground out

svcsubproc.title: Diagnostics for Verifying Rough Idle

step1.para: Verify complaint. Confirm conditions when complaint is present.
When does engine rough idle occur?

item.para: Is there chassis vibration or any other conditions/observations present when engine idles rough.

step1.para: Inspect exhaust system for contact with cab, frame or body of vehicle.
Engine exhaust pipe contact with cab may transmit engine vibrations to cab, especially on acceleration or engine shifts. This condition may be incorrectly diagnosed as a rough idle complaint.

svcsubproc.para: Complete the following tests on the Performance Diagnostic form EGED-250. See Section 6 in this manual for specific details on each test.

step1.para: Do Test 1 (Engine Oil) on form EGED-250. Check engine oil level. Verify correct oil grade for ambient temperature. Refer to the Engine Operation and Maintenance Manual, Engine Lubrication Requirements section. Confirm oil meets correct API specification for your model and year of engine.

Do Test 2 (Fuel) on form EGED-250. Verify quality and quantity of diesel fuel. Poor quality fuel or low cetane rating can cause white smoking, engine misfire, and low power. Refer to the Engine Operation and Maintenance Manual, Fuel Requirements section for your model and year of engine to determine minimum necessary fuel grade and cetane rating.
Do Test 3 (Fuel Pressure) on form EGED-250. Measure transfer pump pressure. Low fuel pressure will cause the engine to misfire and will cause a loss of power.

item.para: If fuel pressure is low, remove canister mounted on fuel pump and remove any debris on fuel inlet screen.

step1.para: Do Test 4 (Fuel Inlet Restriction) on form EGED-250 using the fuel inlet restriction adapter.

item.para: Remove fuel pressure regulator from side of fuel filter housing and inspect valve and spring for damage. Inspect the rubber seat on the valve for tearing or swelling. Remove any foreign material found.

step1.para: Do Test 5 (Diagnostic Trouble Codes) on form EGED-250. Intermittent sensor, injector or wiring harness faults can affect engine idle conditions. The ECM may have detected and recorded these conditions.
Do Test 6 (Key On Engine Off Standard Test) on form EGED-250. The KOEO Standard Test will verify electrical operation of all sensors and actuators.
Do Test 7 (Key On Engine Off Injector Test) on form EGED-250. This test will verify that the injectors are working electronically.

Do air in fuel and fuel return flow test. Install a clear line on the return fuel line and check to see if air bubbles are present while engine is running. An excessive amount of air indicates a suction side air leak or damaged injector gasket. These problems will cause rough idle and/or poor performance. If there is a question about what is excessive air, locate a good running vehicle and compare fuel flow.

Do Test 12 (Key On Engine Running Standard Test) on form EGED-250. This test will verify the functionality of the Injection Control Pressure (ICP) system. The engine must be at operating temperature 70°C (158°F) to do this test.
Do Test 16 (Injection Control Pressure) on form EGED-250. This test will confirm if the Injection Control Pressure (ICP) system is functioning properly and verify ICP stability.
Do Test 17 (Crankcase Pressure) on form EGED-250. This test will determine the condition of the power cylinders and base engine.

Do Test 18 (Injector Disable) on form EGED-250. The primary function of this test is to show the contributions of the individual power cylinders. The test will detect a weak cylinder which could be the result of an injector or base engine problem.

item.para: Test 18 is used in conjunction with Test 19 (Relative Compression) to distinguish between an injector or mechanical problem.

step1.para: Do Test 19 (Relative Compression) on form EGED-250. This will verify base engine compression.

item.para: Test 19 is used in conjunction with Test 18 (Injector Disable) to distinguish between an injector or mechanical problem.

step1.para: Inspect for engine and flywheel balance. Engine roughness at idle that gets worse with a no load acceleration may be caused by an out of balance condition.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, support the vibration damper during mounting bolt removal. The damper can slide off the nose of the crankshaft very easily.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, you must always replace all four bolts when installing the vibration damper.
Do not use anti-seize compounds, grease, or any lubricants whatsoever. Lubricants have an adverse effect on torque results.

item.para: Following the procedures in the Engine Service Manual remove the vibration damper and inspect the elastomer layer for cracks and misalignment. If no problem is found, reinstall vibration damper following the exact assembly procedures found in the Engine Service Manual. Verify that locating dowel at the end of the crankshaft is aligned with locating hole in the balancer for proper installation.

Isolate the engine from transmission by removing the transmission, clutch and pressure plate or torque converter. Start the engine and evaluate for roughness. If the engine runs smooth, replace the torque converter or replace clutch and pressure plate.

Following the procedures in the Engine Service Manual, remove the flywheel and verify proper orientation. If orientation is correct, replace or rebalance flywheel. When removing/installing the flywheel, ensure that the locating dowel is in the right place and that the flywheel is located properly on the dowel.
Following the procedures in the Engine Service Manual, remove the lower and upper oil pan and inspect the crankshaft counterweights to ensure balance holes exist.
